perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is made this 21st day of January 2003 by and between Lucent Technologies Inc., a Delaware corporation having a principal place of business at 600 Mountain Avenue, Murray Hill, New Jersey 07974 ("Lucent") and mPhase Technologies Inc., a New Jersey corporation located at 587 Connecticut Avenue, Norwalk, Connecticut 068545 ("mPhase") (each individually, "a Party" and, collectively, "the Parties"}.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is made this 21st day of January 2003 by and between Lucent Technologies Inc., a Delaware corporation having a principal place of business at 600 Mountain Avenue, Murray Hill, New Jersey 07974 ("Lucent") and mPhase Technologies Inc., a New Jersey corporation located at 587 Connecticut Avenue, Norwalk, Connecticut 068545 ("mPhase") (each individually, "a Party" and, collectively, "the Companies").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Parties' to 'Companies' introduces ambiguity. While contextually similar, 'Companies' might imply a parent-subsidiary or affiliated relationship, impacting liability and obligations differently than the explicitly defined 'Parties' to the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: In the event that mPhase becomes aware of any unauthorized use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo or other Lucent marks by third parties, mPhase agrees to promptly notify Lucent and to cooperate fully, at Lucent's expense, in any enforcement of Lucent's rights against such third parties. Nothing contained in this paragraph shall be construed to require Lucent to enforce any rights against third parties or to restrict Lucent's rights to license or consent to such third parties' use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo or any other Lucent marks.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that mPhase becomes aware of any unauthorized use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo or other Lucent marks by external entities, mPhase agrees to promptly notify Lucent and to cooperate fully, at Lucent's expense, in any enforcement of Lucent's rights against such external entities. Nothing contained in this paragraph shall be construed to require Lucent to enforce any rights against external entities or to restrict Lucent's rights to license or consent to such external entities' use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo or any other Lucent marks.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'third parties' to 'external entities' broadens the scope. 'Third parties' typically refers to unrelated entities, while 'external entities' could arguably include affiliates or partners of either Lucent or mPhase, creating confusion about the notification and cooperation requirements.

perturbation.original_text: Upon termination of this Agreement, mPhase shall immediately cease use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo, provided, however, that mPhase shall have no obligation to remove such Co-Branding Logo from any Goods sold prior to the date of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon termination of this Agreement, mPhase shall immediately cease use of the Lucent Co-Branding Logo, provided, however, that mPhase shall have no obligation to remove such Co-Branding Logo from any Products sold prior to the date of such termination.
perturbation.explanation: Switching from 'Goods' to 'Products' introduces ambiguity. While often used synonymously, 'Products' could be interpreted more broadly than 'Goods'. In this context, it could lead to disputes over whether services or software, if associated with the logo, also fall under the exception allowing continued use after termination.
